Thank you!

Students in Mrs. K’s 4th grade science class participated in a S.T.E.M. activity titled “Snowball Slinger.”
Students engineered a device to project a “snowball” (Pom-Pom) forward using a variety of materials.
Students developed ideas, designed devices, made adjustments, and took part in a friendly competition with classmates.
Through this experience they learned about force/motion angles, design/development, measurement, and more.

The farthest “snowball” was projected over 21 feet this year!
